Over the past 12 weeks, the Sizer Food Pantry has delivered well over 400 bags of groceries to students and families throughout the region. The outpouring of support from the community has truly helped carry me through some difficult days and I know how much this support has meant to some of the most vulnerable among us.

Next week is our final week for home deliveries, and we will be working with folks to get set up with additional resources as needed. If anyone is in a position to help, we could definitely use any/all of the following: cereal, granola bars, pasta sauce, snacks (crackers, pretzels, popcorn), fruit cups, macaroni and cheese, canned chicken/tuna, baking mixes (people always seem to love the brownie mixes), and rice.

The photos below show a regular Monday delivery as well as an example of what gets dropped off each week.

To make a donation, contact foodpantry@sizerschool.org.

With a strong focus on mental wellness, we hope that this art contest will strengthen protective factors which will aid in youth substance use prevention while youth are stuck at home. We'll be offering prizes (TBD) to three youth -- one from each age group (10-13, 14-17, and 18-21).

What I miss most about our wonderful Sizer community is the way each one of us connected and grew so close to one another. Our bonds have become tightly woven together and not seeing each other has been a real struggle. I especially enjoyed spending time with my friends, talking with them and laughing with them about silly things. I also loved being in the classroom with my awesome teachers, who have always been kind and gracious with their attitude, work/assignments, and have always worked their hardest. Above all, our Sizer community is loving, and cares for each student, accepting them for who they are

Thank you so much for sharing, Audrey. And thank you Camden S. for sharing this Seuss inspired creation.

March 11 at 5:45 PM · Fitchburg, MA ·

Today, Sizer School seniors presented their Senior Products to peers, faculty and community leaders during Sizer School's Annual event.

The Senior Class of 2020 has done everything from organizing fundraisers, to creating theater art workshops to improve mental health. Sizer School has currently stopped accepting applications for the 2020-2021 school year for grades 7, 8 & 9. However, Sizer has the right to re-open the application window as needed per our enrollment policy (see below):

"Sizer School will re-open applications after March 1st at grades 7, 8, and/or 9 if the principal enrollment process fails to fill the available slots or the generated waitlist from the principal lottery at the respective grade level is exhausted. Note that in the instance in which Sizer School accepts additional applications for grades where a waitlist has already been established from the principal lottery, Sizer will exhaust the initial waitlist prior to holding another lottery for those additional applications. ...If the principal enrollment process fails to fill available admission spaces, Sizer School may repeat the process more than once providing such process is fair and open."

Visit www.sizerschool.org for more information and to find out when we will re-open our application window!
